--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "itcdeadpeople" <ITCdeadpeople@...> 
wrote:
>
> Hi Andy.  I know everyone doesn't feel as I do, but I too disregard 
everything that isn't 
> relevant when I'm using any of the sweep methods.  As for any 
special practices, I find that 
> the more clear I am with my intention for the session, usually the 
better results I get.  
> 
> Some of the criteria I use when deciding whether or not to accept 
content in a session as 
> intentional communication is:
> 
> 	The spoken phrase is directly relevant to my preceding 
question or comment.  In 
> some cases it is immediate, just as it would be in normal 
conversation.
> 	The duration of the response spans at least one full cycle of 
the back/forth sweep, 
> sometimes several.
> 	The words are spoken in a single tone of voice.
> 	The intonation and cadence are suggestive of that which is 
considered normal human 
> speech pattern.
> 	The validation by a loved one recognizing the voice and words.  
Though subjective, I 
> find it persuasive.
> 
> 
> I have examples of various methods I've tried and explanations of 
the clips posted in my 
> folder (Margaret Downey) here on the boards if you'd like to hear 
some of my results.  I've 
> done a lot of work with the EVPM/allophones combo.
> 
> Margaret
>
